violations.description: Ensure ARIA attributes are not prohibited for an element's role
violations.help: [HOME] Elements must only use permitted ARIA attributes

none.message: aria-label attribute cannot be used on a app-mat-search-bar with no valid role attribute.

nodes.html: <app-mat-search-bar _ngcontent-ng-c626450081="" id="searchQuery" aria-label="Click to search" _nghost-ng-c2529363319="" class="ng-tns-c2529363319-0 ng-star-inserted">
nodes.failureSummary:
Fix all of the following:
  aria-label attribute cannot be used on a app-mat-search-bar with no valid role attribute.

violations.description: Ensure the contrast between foreground and background colors meets WCAG 2 AA minimum contrast ratio thresholds
violations.help: [HOME] Elements must meet minimum color contrast ratio thresholds

any.message: Element has insufficient color contrast of 3.71 between the foreground and shadow color (foreground color: #ffffff, text-shadow color: #609233, font size: 13.5pt (18px), font weight: bold). Expected contrast ratio of 4.5:1

violations.description: Ensure every form element has a label

any.message: Element does not have an implicit (wrapped) <label>
Element does not have an explicit <label>
aria-label attribute does not exist or is empty
aria-labelledby attribute does not exist, references elements that do not exist or references elements that are empty
Element's default semantics were not overridden with role="none" or role="presentation"

nodes.failureSummary:
Fix any of the following:
  Element does not have an implicit (wrapped) <label>
  Element does not have an explicit <label>
  aria-label attribute does not exist or is empty
  aria-labelledby attribute does not exist, references elements that do not exist or references elements that are empty
  Element has no title attribute
  Element has no placeholder attribute
  Element's default semantics were not overridden with role="none" or role="presentation"
